Class SumdokuSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • SumdokuSolver

  • public class SumdokuSolver
extends java.lang.Object
    The objects of this class are solvers of Sumdoku puzzles provided during the object's construction. These solvers use a brute force strategy.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SumdokuSolver(int[][] g, int[] groupValues)
      Builds a Sumdoku solver for a specific puzzle with square grid of size between 3 and 9, represented as an int matrix and an int array.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[][][] findSolutions(int maxSolutions)
      Searches for at most maxSolutions for the puzzle and provides them as an array of size x size int matrices.
      int howManySolutions(int maxSolutions)
      Searches for at most maxSolutions for the puzzle and counts them.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SumdokuSolver

        public SumdokuSolver(int[][] g,
                     int[] groupValues)
        Builds a Sumdoku solver for a specific puzzle with square grid of size between 3 and 9, represented as an int matrix and an int array. The matrix defines the group membership of the cells and the array defines the sum of the cells in each group.
        Parameters:
        g - a matrix representing the group membership of the cells
        groupValues - the sum of the cells in each group
        Requires:
        g is a square matrix && g.length >= 3 && g.length <= 9 && 1 <= groupValues.length <= g.length * g.length && for all i,j:[0..groupValues.length[ | 0 < groupValues[i] && for all i,j:[0..g.length[ | 0 <= g[i][j] < groupValues.length && forall k: [0..groupValues.length[ | exists i,j:[0..g.length[ | g[i][j] == k

    • Method Detail

      • howManySolutions

        public int howManySolutions(int maxSolutions)
        Searches for at most maxSolutions for the puzzle and counts them.
        Parameters:
        maxSolutions - the number that limits the search
        Returns:
        the number of solutions found for the puzzle within the given search limit
        Requires:
        maxSolutions > 0
        Ensures:
        \result >= 0

      • findSolutions

        public int[][][] findSolutions(int maxSolutions)
        Searches for at most maxSolutions for the puzzle and provides them as an array of size x size int matrices.
        Parameters:
        maxSolutions - the number that limits the search.
        Returns:
        the set of solutions found for the puzzle within the given search limit.
        Requires:
        maxSolutions > 0
